repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body: This should fix issue #6927 by setting .not_none on CFuncTypeArg node created when analyzing args. Should other attributes of the original node also be copied?

comment_data.body:
The test should also include a call to `non_none_arg_hint` from Python (i.e. in the doctest) just to show that they're behaving the same (since I think the bug report is that they're not behaving the same)

Edit: Actually that's probably not a quite right understanding of the issue, but the extra check might be a good idea anyway
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -190,3 +190,16 @@ def test_memslice_slice_assign2(double[:] buf):
     TypeError: Cannot slice None memoryview slice
     """
     buf[:] = buf[::-1]
+
+cpdef non_none_arg_hint(a: MyClass):
+    return a
+    
+def test_call_non_none_arg_hint_with_none():
+    """
+    >>> test_call_non_none_arg_hint_with_none()

comment_data.body:
We try to set attributes only when they are modified from the default, to avoid cluttering the namespaces and wasting dict memory.
```suggestion
            func_arg = PyrexTypes.CFuncTypeArg(name, type, arg_node.pos)
            if arg_node.not_none:
                func_arg.not_none = True
            if arg_node.or_none:
                func_arg.or_none = True
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -717,8 +717,9 @@ def analyse(self, return_type, env, nonempty=0, directive_locals=None, visibilit
             # Catch attempted C-style func(void) decl
             if type.is_void:
                 error(arg_node.pos, "Use spam() rather than spam(void) to declare a function with no arguments.")
-            func_type_args.append(
-                PyrexTypes.CFuncTypeArg(name, type, arg_node.pos))
+            single_func_type_arg = PyrexTypes.CFuncTypeArg(name, type, arg_node.pos)
+            single_func_type_arg.not_none = arg_node.not_none
+            func_type_args.append(single_func_type_arg)

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
def test_call_non_none_arg_hint_with_none():
    """
    >>> non_none_arg_hint(None)  # doctest: +ELLIPSIS
    Traceback (most recent call last):
    TypeError: Argument 'a' has incorrect type ...
    >>> test_call_non_none_arg_hint_with_none()
```

comment_data.body:
```suggestion


# Arg types specified in annotations do not allow None.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -365,3 +365,20 @@ def notype_not_none(o not None):
     TypeError: Argument 'o' must not be None
     """
     return type(o).__name__
+
+# Args types specified with annotations are not None

commit.message: Fix passing None to a function with a not None argument

Move tests from nonecheck to ext_type_none_args

title: Insert a None check before calling a function with a not None argument
